Hi there,
>I am receiving a message called "Class not found" after running ..
...<snip>...
>I also made sure that my CLASSPATH is set properly as:
>CLASSPATH=c:\Program Files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar

I believe the space in the directory name could be the issue. You could do
two things
1) Try placing quotes around the directory like so
CLASSPATH="c:\Program Files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar"

or do it my preferred way ;-)
2) Install junit into it's own folder under root like so :-
CLASSPATH="c:\junit\junit3.8.1\junit.jar"

Hope this helps

regards George
